examples: He didn't enjoy washing his car, but it was so dirty that he did it anyway .

definitions.definition: Used to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous statement . See anyhow and at least .
examples: I don't think that's true. I haven't found any evidence, anyway .

definitions.definition: Used to indicate a change of subject.
Used at the end of a question for emphasis, or to direct the conversation to something of more broad importance (compare with more to the point ).

secondary_definitions: Used to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous statement . See anyhow and at least . [from 19th c.]
Used to indicate a change of subject.
Used at the end of a question for emphasis, or to direct the conversation to something of more broad importance (compare with more to the point ).
